seriesJson.title: Ruffled feathers: The Dakota Sioux
seriesJson.description: A documentary series about the history, culture and contemporary problems of the Sioux, a Native American tribe.

node.title: ICAP: A key to the future?
node.description: The Indian Community Action Project aids the Sioux Indian in many ways. This program looks at those ways.

node.title: Life on and off the reservation
node.description: This program tells stories of Sioux life on and off the reservation.

node.title: Sioux legal systems
node.description: This program focuses on elements of Sioux legal systems.

node.title: Tourism and Sioux economic development
node.description: This program focuses on tourism and Sioux economic development.

node.title: The economics of being Indian
node.description: Per capita income, job opportunity, work skills, and prejudice determine the environment that the average Sioux must exist in.

node.title: The Indian in college
node.description: Social adaptability, financial problems, and background are just a few of the factors which determine the success or failure of the Native American in college.

node.title: Educational trends among the Sioux
node.description: Evolution of the Sioux educational process and implications of existing system are discussed.

node.title: The Sioux philosophy
node.description: The carefully structured relationships within the tribe give the Sioux a much different set of values from those found in the society into which they assimilate.

node.title: Patterns of Sioux religion
node.description: From traditional culture has arisen a combination of old and new: Indian and Christian. The Native Church of America, which uses peyote, is also prominent.

node.title: Elements of Sioux art
node.description: This program explores elements of Sioux art. Nationally noted Indian artist Oscar Howe and other midwestern Indian artists discuss the evolution of Indian art.

node.title: Sioux dances and music
node.description: This program focuses on Sioux dances and music. It features Edgar Red Cloud, fourth generation grandson of Chief Red Cloud, singing traditional Sioux songs. The music was recorded at the 1966 Oglala Sioux Sun Dance Pow Wow.

node.title: Contemporary Sioux history
node.description: This program focuses on contemporary Sioux history. The movement of the Sioux peoples is traced. Other issues covered include Indian treaties; Indian wars; impact of non-Indian settlement; and the impact of the reservation system.

node.title: Legendary Sioux history
node.description: This program explores some legends and folklore in Sioux Indian history.
